title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: interest fostering open welcoming environment, contributors maintainers pledge making participation project community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, religion, sexual identity orientation.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes creating positive environment include: Using welcoming inclusive language respectful differing viewpoints experiences Gracefully accepting constructive criticism Focusing best community Showing empathy towards community members Examples unacceptable behavior participants include: use sexualized language imagery unwelcome sexual attention advances Trolling, insulting/derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical electronic address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Project maintainers responsible clarifying standards acceptable behavior expected take appropriate fair corrective action response instances unacceptable behavior. Project maintainers right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, ban temporarily permanently contributor behaviors deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within project spaces public spaces individual representing project community. Examples representing project community include using official project e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event. Representation project may defined clarified project maintainers.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported contacting project team analytics-unit@nhsx.nhs.uk. complaints reviewed investigated result response deemed necessary appropriate circumstances. project team obligated maintain confidentiality regard reporter incident. details specific enforcement policies may posted separately. Project maintainers follow enforce Code Conduct good faith may face temporary permanent repercussions determined members project’s leadership.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct

title: Contributing
text: Please see GDS Git style guide ‘store source code’ page GDS Way, describes prefer Git history commit messages read.

title: Contributing
text: open GitHub pull request repo, please update CHANGELOG reflect contribution. Add entry Unreleased : - Breaking changes - New features - Fixes Internal changes project part public API need changelog entries, example fixing CI build server. sections follow semantic versioning, : Breaking changes corresponds major (1.X.X) change. New features corresponds minor (X.1.X) change. Fixes corresponds patch (X.X.1) change. See CHANGELOG.md example looks.

title: Open Code Checklist
text: ensure code publish appropraite, clear reusable require set way working pushing code private public repoistories. difficult set precise generic standards ask following checklist considered mandatroy items filled .

previous_headings: When publishing your code you need to make sure:
what: you’re clear about who owns the code and how others can use it
title: Open Code Checklist
text: code appropriate licence copyright notice? (Mandatory) README document intended purpose? (Mandatory) README clear concise? (Optional - use analytics unit template example) need consider MHRA ‘software medical device’ guidance? (Mandatory - use flowchart) responsibility ongoing support communications code? (Optional Best practice assign, else state code maintained last update ) responsible disclosure process security issues defined? (Mandatory - use github issues) address identified issues security concerns? (Mandatory. - assign monitoring disclosure process) semantic versioning used? (Optional) contribution guidelines PR style guides included? (Optional) package dependencies libaries documented versions? (Optional) code linked published outputs others can easily link code? (Optional)

previous_headings: When publishing your code you need to make sure:
what: You do not release information that should remain closed
title: Open Code Checklist
text: code include sensitive, personal, secret top secret data/information? (Mandatory) code include unreleased policy? (Mandatory) code include business sensitive algorithms (e.g. finance allocations)? (Mandatory) written permission obtained data stored data owner? (Mandatory) owners services code fulfils aware release? (Mandatory) data transfers conducted safely securely? (Mandatory) credentials contained source code? (Mandatory - check current version git history) secret keys contained source code? (Mandatory - check current version git history) SQL server addresses connection strings source code? (Mandatory - check current version git history) commit messages informative? (Optional) commit messages include sensitive information (e.g. names)? (Mandatory) git history contain sensitive information (e.g. one time real data credentials code since removed) (Mandatory) notebook outputs removed/checked sensitive information? (Mandatory - check appropriate outputs maybe useful: Example) configuration written code separated analytical code? (Optional) checked screenshots figures outputs documentation information shouldn’t released? (Mandatory)

previous_headings: When publishing your code you need to make sure:
what: You store it in a repository managed by your department (to make licensing/copyright clear)
title: Open Code Checklist
text: code version controlled using GIT similar? (Optional) code stored organisational GitHub account? organisation funds relevant staff time? (Optional)

previous_headings: When publishing your code you need to make sure:
what: Any third-party tools you use to host or manage your code follow the National Cyber Security Centre’s cloud security guidance
title: Open Code Checklist
text: third party tools used within code? (Mandatory check. Best practice keep inventory) adhere NCSC’s Cloud Security Principles? (Mandatory)

previous_headings: When publishing your code you need to make sure:
what: An internal code review has been completed
title: Open Code Checklist
text: colleague reviewed code sensitive data content security vulnerabilities? (Mandatory - Best practice record automated code quality security tools used) code quality review completed focussing end usability clarity? (Optional - consider runing example similar code quality checklist) code assessed level RAP(Reproducible Analytical Pipeline)? (Optional) code undergone level testing. level teting required depend specific code use-case minimum work fresh environment arteficial data. (Optional)

what: Create the calibration dataset from the main data table — create_modelling_data
title: Create the calibration dataset from the main data table — create_modelling_data
text: Create calibration dataset main data table

title: Create the calibration dataset from the main data table — create_modelling_data
Create the calibration dataset from the main data table — create_modelling_data
text: data table referrals, competes incompletes (different types); data needs following field names: trust, specialty, period_id, type, months_waited_id, value max_months_waited integer; stock pool stocks waited longer referrals_uplift numeric; single value - parameter apply   referral inputs (absolute value renege_params first stock   calibrating models). occur due -reporting   referrals data. applied observed referrals using   following formula: $$referrals_{adjusted} = referrals_{obs} + (referrals_{obs} *   uplift\_parameter)$$ See details information argument applied.

title: Create the calibration dataset from the main data table — create_modelling_data
text: maths stock = 0. know: (Equation 1) $$incomplete_{obs} = referrals_{obs} - complete_{obs} -   reneges_{calc}$$ , \(reneges_{calc}\) negative, want adjust referrals   amount $$incompletes_{obs} = referrals\_adj_{calc} - complete_{obs}$$ (Equation 2) $$referrals\_adj_{calc} = referrals_{obs} +   reneges_{calc}$$ (\(reneges_{calc}\) equation 1) ALSO (Equation 3) $$renege\_param_{calc} = \frac{reneges_{calc}}{referrals_{obs}}$$ THEREFORE, combining eq. 2 eq. 3 (substituting \(reneges_{calc}\)) (Equation 4) $$renege\_param_{calc} = \frac{referrals\_adj_{calc} -   referrals_{obs}}{referrals_{obs}}$$ REARRANGING eq. 4 $$referrals\_adj_{calc} = (renege\_param_{calc} * referrals_{obs}) +   referrals_{obs}$$

title: Run the Shiny Application — run_app
text: Run Shiny Application

title: Run the Shiny Application — run_app
code: run_app(   onStart = NULL,   options = list(),   enableBookmarking = NULL,   uiPattern = "/",   ... )

title: Run the Shiny Application — run_app
text: onStart function called app actually run. needed shinyAppObj, since shinyAppDir case, global.R file can used purpose. options Named options passed runApp call (can following: "port", "launch.browser", "host", "quiet", "display.mode" "test.mode"). can also specify width height parameters provide hint embedding environment ideal height/width app. enableBookmarking Can one "url", "server", "disable". default value, NULL, respect setting previous calls  enableBookmarking(). See enableBookmarking() information bookmarking app. uiPattern regular expression applied GET request determine whether ui used handle request. Note entire request path must match regular expression order match considered successful. ... arguments pass golem_opts. See `?golem::get_golem_options` details.
